Class Inventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • Inventory

  • public class Inventory
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to handle inventory of a specific library, all method inputs are case in-sensitive

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Inventory(java.lang.String libraryName)
      Constructor, populates arrays with data saved in files for that library

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Add an entry to a library's inventory
      void checkIn(java.lang.String type, java.lang.String title, java.lang.String creator)
      Marks the first occurrence of that entry with an in/out tag of "out" as "in"
      void checkOut(java.lang.String type, java.lang.String title, java.lang.String creator)
      Marks the first occurrence of that entry with an in/out tag of "in" as "out"
      int[] findIndex(java.lang.String type, java.lang.String title, java.lang.String creator)
      Returns the indexes of all instances of an entry
      java.lang.String[] getPosition(java.lang.String type, int index)
      Gets entry data from an index

      Remove an entry from a library's inventory.

      Writes all arrays to their appropriate files

      Search a library's inventor based on type and creator

    • Constructor Detail

      • Inventory

        public Inventory(java.lang.String libraryName)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Constructor, populates arrays with data saved in files for that library
        Parameters:
        libraryName - name of the library
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - may error if can't find file. assumes files for specified library are already made and are in the format libraryNameBook.txt

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(java.lang.String type,
                java.lang.String title,
                java.lang.String creator,
                java.lang.String genre1,
                java.lang.String genre2)
        Add an entry to a library's inventory
        Parameters:
        type - book, cd, or dvd
        title - title of the entry
        genre1 - a genre of the entry
        genre2 - a second genre of the entry

      • remove

        public void remove(java.lang.String type,
                   java.lang.String title,
                   java.lang.String creator)
        Remove an entry from a library's inventory. Will only remove entries with an in/out tag of "in"
        Parameters:
        type - book, cd, or dvd
        title - title of entry
        creator - creator of entry you want to remove (author, artist, director)

      • findIndex

        public int[] findIndex(java.lang.String type,
                       java.lang.String title,
                       java.lang.String creator)
        Returns the indexes of all instances of an entry
        Parameters:
        type - book, dvd, or cd
        title - title of entry being looked for
        creator - creator of entry you want to find (author, artist, director)
        Returns:
        int[] holding indexes of every instance (for if multiple copies exist)

      • getPosition

        public java.lang.String[] getPosition(java.lang.String type,
                                      int index)
        Gets entry data from an index
        Parameters:
        type - book, cd, or dvd (case sensitive)
        index - index of wanted entry
        Returns:
        entry data as a String[]

      • getTag

        public java.lang.String getTag(java.lang.String type,
                               int index,
                               int tag)
        Gets a single tag of a single entry
        Parameters:
        type - book, dvd, or cd
        index - index of entry
        tag - index of wanted tag
        Returns:
        a String holding the tag's value

      • searchName

        public java.lang.String[][] searchName(java.lang.String type,
                                       java.lang.String title)
        Search inventory based on type and title
        Parameters:
        type - book, dvd, or cd
        title - title of what you're searching for
        Returns:
        a String[][] containing the data of all entries with that title

      • searchCreator

        public java.lang.String[][] searchCreator(java.lang.String type,
                                          java.lang.String creator)
        Search a library's inventor based on type and creator
        Parameters:
        type - book, dvd, or cd
        creator - creator of entry you want to find (author, artist, director)
        Returns:
        String[][] of all works by that creator

      • searchGenre

        public java.lang.String[][] searchGenre(java.lang.String type,
                                        java.lang.String genre)
        Search inventory based on type and genre
        Parameters:
        type - book, dvd, or cd
        genre - genre being searched for
        Returns:
        a String[][] containing the data of all entries of that genre

      • checkIn

        public void checkIn(java.lang.String type,
                    java.lang.String title,
                    java.lang.String creator)
        Marks the first occurrence of that entry with an in/out tag of "out" as "in"
        Parameters:
        type - book, dvd, or cd
        title - tile of entry
        creator - creator of entry you want to find (author, artist, director)

      • checkOut

        public void checkOut(java.lang.String type,
                     java.lang.String title,
                     java.lang.String creator)
        Marks the first occurrence of that entry with an in/out tag of "in" as "out"
        Parameters:
        type - book, dvd, or cd
        title - tile of entry
        creator - creator of entry you want to find (author, artist, director)

      • save

        public void save()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Writes all arrays to their appropriate files
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - will throw an error if it can not write to file. can make a new file, so should not throw unless disk is full
